doc.after: During the first 20 years of South Korea's growth surge, little effort was made to preserve the environment.[40] Unchecked industrialization and urban development have resulted in deforestation and the ongoing destruction of wetlands such as the Songdo Tidal Flat.[41] However, there have been recent efforts to balance these problems, including a government run $84 billion five-year green growth project that aims to boost energy efficiency and green technology.[42][43]
